questions.question_text: Mumukshune utkrusht gunni prāpti thāy tenu kāran shu chhe? To Bhagwānnī kathā-vārtā sāmbhalyāmā jene jețalī prīti tene tețalo jagatno abhāv thay tathā kām, krodh, lobhādik _____ nāsh thāy.
questions.explanation: According to Vach.Ga.An.24, the more one loves listening to Bhagwan's kathā-vārtā, the more the world's absence is felt and the more sins like lust, anger, and greed are destroyed.

questions.question_text: Vishvās rākhīne prītie sahit je Bhagwan Purushottam Nārāyaņnī vāt sāmbhaļvī ethī bīju manne sthir thavānu ne nirvişhayī thavānu koi moțu sādhan nathī. Aa vākhya kyānu chhe?
questions.explanation: The quote is directly from Vach.Ka.12.

questions.question_text: Vishvās rākhīne prītie sahit je Bhagwan Purushottam Nārāyaņnī vāt sāmbhaļvī ethī bīju manne _____ thavānu ne nirvişhayī thavānu koi moțu sādhan nathī.
questions.explanation: According to Vach.Ka.12, listening to the words of Bhagwan Purushottam Narayan with faith and love is a great means of stabilizing the mind and becoming detached.

questions.question_text: Bhagwān ne Sādhunā mahimānī vātu _____ karavī ne sāmbhaļvī.
questions.explanation: According to Swa.Vato.1/1, one should constantly talk and listen to the greatness of God and the Sadhu.

questions.question_text: Bhagwān ne Sādhunā mahimānī vātu nirantar karavī ne sāmbhaļvī. Aa vākhya kyānu chhe?
questions.explanation: The quote is directly from Swa.Vato.1/1.
